Package com.pranab.playwithgraphs.weightedgraphs.directed

Class DirectedWeightedNode<V,​K,​W extends Weight>

java.lang.Object
com.pranab.playwithgraphs.weightedgraphs.WeightedNode<V,​K,​W>
com.pranab.playwithgraphs.weightedgraphs.directed.DirectedWeightedNode<V,​K,​W>
Type Parameters:
V - - The value of object to be maintained in the Graph's Node/Vertex.
K - - Keys of target node to store the relationships associated with a node.
W - An entity that implements Weight so as to simulate strength of relationship as integer values.
public class DirectedWeightedNode<V,​K,​W extends Weight>
extends WeightedNode<V,​K,​W>
The object of this class is basic building unit i.e. Node/Vertex for Weighed Directed Graph.
Weighted Directed Graph- a set of vertices or nodes that are connected together, where all the edges are directed from one vertex to another having varying weight. A directed graph is sometimes called a digraph or a directed network.
It maintains the properties apart from the properties inherited from Node:
prevPointer- Reference to the node from which one arrives to the current node.
level- the distance of current from source node considering the path length to be unity.
inComingEdges - the list of incoming edges to the current node.
Author:
Pranab Bharadwaj
